---
title: Viewing Content Usage Information
---

## Problem

You want to view usage information.

## Solution

:::{.panel-tabset group="language"}

## Python

Use the `metrics.usage` attribute to view usage event information. The `find_one` method retrieves a single usage event.

```{.python}
from posit import connect

client = connect.Client()
usage_event = client.metrics.usage.find_one()
```

The usage event describes access to content by a user.

```{.python}
>>> import json
>>> print(json.dumps(usage_event, indent=4))
{
    "content_guid": "2243770d-ace0-4782-87f9-fe2aeca14fc8",
    "user_guid": "434f97ab-4b97-4443-8490-ed1052f37b29",
    "variant_key": "dZnFUBMR",
    "rendering_id": "3029259",
    "bundle_id": "49747",
    "started": "2023-10-27T16:19:40Z",
    "ended": "2023-10-27T16:19:40Z",
    "data_version": 3,
    "path": null
}
```
